thread.title: Former Beach Volleyball Standout Hildreth Named National Volleyball League Rookie of the Year
thread.title_full: Former Beach Volleyball Standout Hildreth Named National Volleyball League Rookie of the Year

title: Former Beach Volleyball Standout Hildreth Named National Volleyball League Rookie of the Year
text: Former Beach Volleyball Standout Hildreth Named National Volleyball League Rookie of the Year North Florida Athletics was selected at the National Volleyball League's (NVL) 2015 Female Rookie of the Year. The NVL is a professional beach volleyball league that was established in 2010. In her first season in the league, Hildreth reached the Winner's Bracket in six tournaments. Hildreth got her highest finishes of the season when she was teamed with 2014 NVL MVP and Best Offensive Player Karolina Sowala. Hildreth and Sowala reached the quarterfinals at Mason Apr. 24-26 and then made it to the finals at Hermosa Beach Aug. 6-8. Hildreth compiled 2,640 points in the players standings and advanced to the 2015 NVL Players Championships that were in Port St. Lucie, Fla., Sept. 25-27. Hildreth, who played indoor volleyball at Eastern Michigan for four seasons, competed as a fifth-year during the Ospreys' 2014 beach volleyball season. She compiled a 27-11 overall record and 17-7 in dual matches with . The pair qualified for the 2014 AVCA Sand Nationals "Best of the Rest" pool, going 2-2 and advancing to the championship bracket. Hildreth received her master's degree in educational leadership from UNF in August 2015.
